Interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.ISegmentedAsset
Inherited members: ShowHide
Deprecated: ShowHide
View: ClientSubclassPackageImplementation
com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface ISegmentedAsset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAsset, IIdentifier
    public interface ISegmentedAsset extends IAsset
    Interface to segmented assets in Virtuoso. A segmented asset consists of one or more segments. Virtuoso treats this collection of segments as an atomic unit when downloading. Developers can retrieve an instance by calling Virtuoso.createSegmentedAsset or one of its sibling methods in Virtuoso.
    See Also:
    Virtuoso

      abstract int addSegments(Context context, java.util.List<java.lang.String> aSegmentUrls)
      Add a list of segments to this asset, specifying the context to be used.
      int addSegments(Context context, java.util.List<java.lang.String> aSegmentUrls)
      Add a list of segments to this asset, specifying the context to be used. Virtuoso will maintain the order of the segments. The passed-in list must contain the absolute URL of each segment to be downloaded.
      Parameters:
      aSegmentUrls - List of URLs comprising the segments
      context - Context to be used for acquiring the content provider client
      Returns:
      Number of segments successfully added

      getDownloadRetryCount 
      abstract int getDownloadRetryCount()
      Number of times the SDK encountered an error during download of this asset and scheduled a retry.
      int getDownloadRetryCount()
      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      Number of times the SDK encountered an error during download of this asset and scheduled a retry. The retry may not yet have been completed. Once this value reaches the retry limit specified at #getRetryLimit(), the SDK will stop attempting to download the asset.
      The retries may be reset if the maximum retries have been exceeded using IQueue.clearRetryCount(int).
      Returns:
      The error count

      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      Returns the fixed limit for the number of times the SDK will retry a failed download. The SDK will not reattempt a download once this limit is reached, unless the retry count is reset.
      Returns:
      The retry limit.

      getEad 
      abstract long getEad()
      (Expiry After Download or 'EAD') Duration this asset will remain available to the user after it has completed downloading.
      long getEad()
      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      (Expiry After Download or 'EAD') Duration this asset will remain available to the user after it has completed downloading. As soon as possible after EAD has elapsed, Virtuoso will delete the asset.
      Returns:
      Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to be available after download completes.
      getEap 
      abstract long getEap()
      (Expiry After Play or 'EAP') Amount of time this asset will remain available to the user after it has been first played.
      long getEap()
      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      (Expiry After Play or 'EAP') Amount of time this asset will remain available to the user after it has been first played. As soon as possible after EAP has elapsed, Virtuoso will delete this asset. Note: For EAP windowing to work, Virtuoso must know when the asset is first played. It's your responsibility to register a play-start Event with Virtuoso.
      Returns:
      Amount of time (in seconds) the asset is to be available after first playout.
      See Also:
      Common.Events.addPlayStartEvent(Context, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      abstract double getExpectedSize()
      Expected total size of this asset This is an estimated sum of the sizes of all segments belonging to this asset.
      double getExpectedSize()
      Expected total size of this asset This is an estimated sum of the sizes of all segments belonging to this asset. This value will change as Virtuoso downloads additional segments and refines its estimate of the total size.
      Specified by:
      getExpectedSize in interface IAsset

      getFastplayPlaylist 
      abstract java.net.URL getFastplayPlaylist()
      URL for a fastplay manifest suitable for sending to the player.
      java.net.URL getFastplayPlaylist() throws java.net.MalformedURLException
      URL for a fastplay manifest suitable for sending to the player. The returned playlist URL will point at the VirtuosoClientHTTPService, which will deliver the modified manifest and the initial video segments. The service must be running for the player to use it.
      To ensure the service is running, be sure to include the service and metadata declarations in the Android Manifest: 
       
 <meta-data android:name="com.penthera.virtuososdk.clienthttpservice.enabled" android:value="true" />

 <service android:name="com.penthera.virtuososdk.service.VirtuosoClientHTTPService"
            android:label="VirtuosoClientHTTPService"
            android:exported="false"
            android:process=":vservice" >
    <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.START_VIRTUOSO_CLIENT_HTTP_SERVICE" />
    </intent-filter>
 </service>
      Returns:
      URL of the fastplay playlist, or null if outside of the availability window, the asset does not support fastplay or is not ready to play.
      Throws:
      java.net.MalformedURLException

      Returns:

      getLastPermissionResponse 
      abstract IAssetPermission getLastPermissionResponse()
      Permission response from Backplane.
      IAssetPermission getLastPermissionResponse()
      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      Permission response from Backplane.
      The permissions are requested from the backplane if the Max Account Downloads, Max Asset Downloads, or Max Asset Copies settings have been configured. They are also requested if Always Check Permissions setting is configured.
      The permission is evaluated when added to the queue. If configured and the permission check is not required at time of queuing then the permission code in the the IAssetPermission permission code will be set to PERMISSION_AWAITING_PERMISSI0N until the permission is checked at time of download.
      Returns:
      The IAssetPermission or null if not yet added to queue.

      getPlaylist 
      abstract java.net.URL getPlaylist()
      URL suitable for sending to the player.
      java.net.URL getPlaylist() throws java.net.MalformedURLException
      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      URL suitable for sending to the player. The returned playlist URL will point at the VirtuosoClientHTTPService. The service must be running for the player to use it.
      To ensure the service is running, be sure to include the service and metadata declarations in the Android Manifest: 
       
 <meta-data android:name="com.penthera.virtuososdk.clienthttpservice.enabled" android:value="true" />

 <service android:name="com.penthera.virtuososdk.service.VirtuosoClientHTTPService"
            android:label="VirtuosoClientHTTPService"
            android:exported="false"
            android:process=":vservice" >
    <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.START_VIRTUOSO_CLIENT_HTTP_SERVICE" />
    </intent-filter>
 </service>
      For a segmented asset this will be the URL for a manifest. For a flat file it will be the link to the file itself via the HTTP proxy.
      Returns:
      URL of the playlist / file, or null if outside of the availability window
      Throws:
      java.net.MalformedURLException
      getProcessingStatus 
      abstract int getProcessingStatus()
      Current processing state: ok, deleting, expiring.
      int getProcessingStatus()
      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      Current processing state: ok, deleting, expiring. This method indicates if the SDK is currently performing a local action on the asset which will cause it to shortly be removed. Assets which display a state of deleting or expiring will not appear in a list from IAssetProvider.
      Returns:
      The current processing state.

      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      Indicates if this asset has exceeded the maximum number of SDK download retries. In this state the SDK will not retry the download unless the retry count for the asset is reset on the queue using IQueue.clearRetryCount(int).

      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      Set custom HTTP headers for this asset.

      setEndWindow 
      abstract void setEndWindow(long end)
      Set the end window for playback.
      void setEndWindow(long end)
      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      Set the end window for playback.
      After this time, the asset will no longer be available for playback through Virtuoso. Any attempt to retrieve the location of this asset on disk, through a Virtuoso API, will return null.
      After this time, Virtuoso will delete this asset from disk as soon as possible.
      Parameters:
      end - A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch.

      Parameters:

      setStartWindow 
      abstract void setStartWindow(long start)
      Set the start window for playback.
      void setStartWindow(long start)
      Description copied from interface: IAsset
      Set the start window for playback.
      Attempts to access or play this asset through a Virtuoso API will return null until this time has passed.
      A newly-created asset defaults to having a start window of 'now'.
      Parameters:
      start - A timestamp, represented as the number of seconds since the unix epoch.
